info.title: PRO SHIPPING API
info.description:
# Introduction
Here you will find requirements for integrating with PRO SHIPPING API.

The documentation specifically covers how the API can be used by business customers to conduct shipping activity with available carriers and provides the technical information to build this integration. The API allows customers to create and manage shipments, produce labels, customs documentation, and collection manifests, retrieve reference data such as carriers and countries, and maintain their own data such as shipping account details.

Pro Shipping API is a fully RESTful service implemented using JSON messaging. You, as the customer are responsible for sending JSON messages and for maintaining the capability of receiving JSON messages in the format described in this specification. Request and response examples for each API service are included in this specification.

# Authentication

The PRO SHIPPING API uses OAuth2 authentication.

To request the authorization token you need to create API credentials (Client ID and Secret) on the system first. If you have not done it already, log into your account and go to API Credentials or follow the link [add a link here with the path to the API Credentials menu]. Use the credentials to retrieve the authorization token.

Note: Make sure you copy the Secret and keep it secure as you won't be able to view it again on the system.

<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <SecurityDefinitions /> -->

get.description:
Provides a list of all shipping accounts for all carriers (created on your customer account).
Information about the associated carrier, account number, account type, and contact details is included in the response.

parameters.name: searchTerm
parameters.description: Search Term

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of records per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The number of the requested page, starting at 1.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort By
Default: Name

parameters.name: sortDir
parameters.description:
Sort Direction
Default: Ascending

200.description: Returns a paged list of shipping accounts.

Errors.Message: The page size must be 1 or greater.
The page number must be 1 or greater.

get.description:
Provides a list of Royal Mail shipping accounts only.
Information about the account number, account type, and contact details is included in the response.

parameters.name: searchTerm
parameters.description: Search Term

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of records per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The number of the requested page, starting at 1.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort By
Default: Name

parameters.name: sortDir
parameters.description:
Sort Direction
Default: Ascending

200.description: Returns a paged list of shipping accounts for the given carrier.

Errors.Message: The page size must be 1 or greater.
The page number must be 1 or greater.

post.description:
Add a shipping account for Royal Mail and link it with an existing shipping location.
Ensure to have required carrier details ready like Royal Mail account number, Posting Location, OBA access codes and receiving hub, so that you can use the account for shipping with Royal Mail.

200.description: The shipping account was added successfully.

Errors.Message: The account alias is required.
Customer is Restricted to Sandbox.

get.description:
Provides details for a Royal Mail account.
Information about the account number, alias, account type, and contact details is included in the response.

parameters.name: shippingAccountId
parameters.description:
Shipping Account Identifier
PRO SHIPPING Shipping Account Id (assigned by PRO SHIPPING) or Alias (assigned by you).

200.description: Returns the shipping account.

404.description: The shipping account was not found.

put.description:
Update shipping account details.
Note: All required fields must be populated in the request, regardless if they need updating or not.

parameters.name: shippingAccountId
parameters.description:
Shipping Account Identifier
PRO SHIPPING Shipping Account Id (assigned by PRO SHIPPING) or Alias (assigned by you).

200.description: The shipping account was updated successfully.

404.description: The shipping account was not found.

Errors.Message: The account alias is required.
Customer is Restricted to Sandbox.

post.description:
Link one or more shipping locations with a Royal Mail shipping account.
Ensure to have required carrier details ready: Royal Mail Posting Location number, OBA access codes and receiving hub, so that you can link it successfully.

parameters.name: shippingAccountId
parameters.description:
Shipping Account Identifier
PRO SHIPPING Shipping Account Id (assigned by PRO SHIPPING) or Alias (assigned by you).

requestBody.description:
Shipping Locations
The locations to associate with this shipping account.

200.description: The shipping location(s) have been linked to the account successfully.

404.description: The shipping account was not found.

Errors.Message: The shipping location was not found

get.description: Provides a list of all shipping locations associated with a Royal Mail shipping account.

parameters.name: shippingAccountId
parameters.description:
Shipping Account Identifier
PRO SHIPPING Shipping Account Id (assigned by PRO SHIPPING) or Alias (assigned by you).

parameters.name: searchTerm
parameters.description: Search Term

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of records per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The number of the requested page, starting at 1.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort By
Default: Name

parameters.name: sortDir
parameters.description:
Sort Direction
Default: Ascending

200.description: Returns a paged list of associated shipping locations.

404.description: The shipping account was not found.

Errors.Message: The page size must be 1 or greater.
The page number must be 1 or greater.

get.description: Provides information for a specific shipping location linked to a Royal Mail shipping account including location alias, Royal Mail specific details, timezone, address, when it was last updated, and by who.

parameters.name: shippingAccountId
parameters.description:
Shipping Account Identifier
PRO SHIPPING Shipping Account Id (assigned by PRO SHIPPING) or Alias (assigned by you).

parameters.name: shippingLocationId
parameters.description:
Shipping Location Identifier
PRO SHIPPING Shipping Location Id (assigned by PRO SHIPPING) or Alias (assigned by you).

200.description: Returns the associated shipping location

404.description: The shipping location was not found.

put.description:
Update a shipping location associated with a specific Royal Mail shipping account with carrier specific details like Posting Location, OBA access code and receiving hub.
Note: All required fields must be populated in the request, regardless if they need updating or not.

parameters.name: shippingAccountId
parameters.description:
Shipping Account Identifier
PRO SHIPPING Shipping Account Id (assigned by PRO SHIPPING) or Alias (assigned by you).

parameters.name: shippingLocationId
parameters.description:
Shipping Location Identifier
PRO SHIPPING Shipping Location Id (assigned by PRO SHIPPING) or Alias (assigned by you).

200.description: Updates the shipping location

404.description: The shipping location was not found.

Errors.Message: The posting location code is required.

put.description: Unlink one or more shipping location from a specific carrier shipping account.

parameters.name: carrierCode
parameters.description: Carrier Code

parameters.name: shippingAccountId
parameters.description:
Shipping Account Identifier
PRO SHIPPING Shipping Account Id (assigned by PRO SHIPPING) or Alias (assigned by you).

requestBody.description:
Shipping Locations
The locations to remove from the account.
At least one location must be provided.

200.description: The location(s) have been unlinked from the shipping account successfully.

404.description: The shipping account or location was not found.

Errors.Message: There must be at least one location associated with the shipping account. You cannot unlink all shipping locations.

parameters.name: carrierCode
parameters.description: Carrier Code

parameters.name: shippingAccountId
parameters.description:
Shipping Account Identifier
PRO SHIPPING Shipping Account Id (assigned by PRO SHIPPING) or Alias (assigned by you).

200.description: The shipping account was deleted successfully.

404.description: The shipping account was not found.

post.description: Create a Royal Mail shipment. This will return an image of the shipping label in PDF, PNG or ZPL format.

200.description: The shipment was created successfully.

Errors.Message: The name maximum length is 50 characters.
The service code is required.

get.description: This changes the status of the shipment to label printed. This should be done at the time of actual printing or label creation dependent on how you operate in reality. Shipments must be updated to printed status prior to manifesting.

parameters.name: shipmentId
parameters.description:
Shipment Id
The Shipment Id may be an id or a tracking/barcode number.

parameters.name: labelFormat
parameters.description:
Label Format

**PDF** Base 64 encoded PDF
**PNG** Base 64 encoded PNG
**DATASTREAM** - Label components broken down into a data-stream, for you to draw your own label
**ZPL203DPI** Base 64 encoded text for Zebra printer at 203 DPI
**ZPL300DPI** Base 64 encoded text for Zebra printer at 300 DPI

*DATASTREAM is only available if it has been activated on your account.*

Defaults To PDF

200.description: Returns the printed label in the format specified.

Errors.Message: The shipment has already been manifested and cannot be reprinted.

get.description:
Request associated QR Code for the associated label in the print label call.
This is only available for Royal Mail Tracked Return Services.

parameters.name: shipmentId
parameters.description:
Shipment Id
The Shipment Id may be an id or a tracking/barcode number.

200.description: Returns the printed QR Code as a Base 64 encoded PNG.

Errors.Message: The service code for this shipment does not support QR Code generation

get.description: Provides a list of shipments for the specified shipping location in a given time period.

parameters.name: shippingLocationId
parameters.description:
Shipping Location Id
PRO SHIPPING Shipping Location Id (assigned by PRO SHIPPING) or Alias (assigned by you).
Filter by shipping location.

parameters.name: shippingAccountId
parameters.description:
Shipping Account Id
PRO SHIPPING Shipping Account Id (assigned by PRO SHIPPING) or Alias (assigned by you).
Filter by shipping account.

parameters.name: carrierCode
parameters.description:
Carrier Code
If shippingAccountId and carrier are both provided, then the value sent in the carrier field will be ignored and the carrier associated with the shipping account will be used.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Status
Filter by shipment status.

parameters.name: destinationCountryCode
parameters.description:
Country Code
ISO Alpha-2 Country Code per ISO 3166 Standard.

parameters.name: dateFrom
parameters.description:
Date From
Defaults to Today's date if not provided.
Format: YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: dateTo
parameters.description:
Date To
Defaults to Today's date if not provided.
Format: YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of records per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The number of the requested page, starting at 1.

200.description: Returns a list of shipments.

Errors.Message: The page size must be 1 or greater.
The page number must be 1 or greater.

404.description: The shipping location was not found.

post.description: Request the associated Customs Documents for the printed label.

parameters.name: carrierCode
parameters.description: Carrier Code

parameters.name: shipmentId
parameters.description:
Shipment Id
The Shipment Id may be an id or a tracking/barcode number.

200.description: Returns the specified document for the given shipment.

Errors.Message: The number of copies must be between 1 and 5.

put.description:
**Hold** - Put the shipments on hold for up to 28 days. Shipments on hold for longer than 28 days will be cancelled. A shipment on hold will not be included in an closeouts/manifests, but instead will remain in its current state. You can only put shipments on hold that are in the 'LabelPrinted' status as only shipments with this status are included in manifests.

**Cancel** - Use to cancel/void one or more current shipments. This can only be used before a shipment has been confirmed by being manifested.

**Release** - Use to release shipments from hold and shipments cancelled for less than 24 hours. Once released, the shipment will be included in the next manifest.

**Picked** - Set the shipment to picked. This means this shipment will only be manifested if you choose to manifest 'Picked' shipments.

200.description: All shipments were updated successfully.

Errors.Message: The reason is required when cancelling shipments.
The shipment has already been manifested and cannot be cancelled.
The shipment does not exist.

put.description:
Used to update the shipment shipping data for a current shipment.
A shipment can be deferred by a maximum of 28 days from the date of the request.
This service can only be used before the shipment has been manifested.
There can be a maximum of 99 defer requests per call.

200.description: All shipments were deferred successfully.

Errors.Message: The Shipment Id is required.
The shipment is in an invalid state to be deferred.
The shipment does not exist.

post.description:
Get barcode ranges for offline barcoding.
Offline Barcoding is only available if it has been activated on your customer account in the GUI.

200.description: Returns the offline barcode ranges successfully.

post.description:
This service can be used to receive a Royal Mail Tracking Number that will be pre-allocated to the service and destination supplied in the request. No shipment or label will be produced from this service.
This service can only be used for services that are assigned a tracking number.
This service must be used in conjunction with CreateShipment service populating the TrackingNumber in the CarrierSpecifics /PreAllocatedBarcode section with the pre-allocated TrackingNumber returned in this service response.

200.description: Returns the pre allocated tracking number successfully.

AccountType.description:
Account Type
Sandbox shipping accounts can only be used for testing your integration.
Production accounts can be used to ship.

LocationAlias.description:
Shipping Location Alias
Your identifier for this shipping location

IsDefaultLocation.description:
Is Default Location
If true, this location is the default location used.
You must have 1 default location.
Set to false if not provided, or true if is the first location to be added.
If true, this will set this location as the default location.

AddShippingAccountLocationNewLocation.description:
Shipping Location

Add a new shipping location to this account.
Either a Shipping Location Id must be provided, or the details of a new shipping location provided.

ShippingAccountId.description:
Shipping Account Id
The PRO SHIPPING Identifier assigned to this shipping account.

ShippingLocationId.description:
Shipping Location Id
The PRO SHIPPING Identifier assigned to the new location (only populated if new location added).

BusinessTransactionType.description:
The Commercial Transaction type of the shipment.
Valid values are:
**B2C** - Business to Consumer
**B2B** - Business to Business
**D2C** - Direct to Consumer
**C2B** - Consumer to Business (i.e. a Returns shipment)
Defaults to B2C if not populated.

ContentType.description:
Valid values are:
**NDX** - Non Documents
**DOX** - Documents
**HV** - Non Documents of High Value

SlotReservationId.description: The SlotReservationId returned in the Get Collection Timeslots response

SlotDate.description: The collection date selected from the available slots in the Get Collection Timeslots response

BringMyLabel.description:
If true, Royal Mail will bring the Label and Custom Declaration if required.
Defaults to false

CollectionDate.description: The date the collection has been booked for

CreateShipmentAction.description:
Determines the shipment status that is set on shipment creation and whether a shipment tracking number and labels are generated.
Valid values are:
**Process** - creates a shipment tracking number, creates and prints a label for each package in the shipment and returns the label(s) in the createShipment Response. The shipment status will be set to Ready to Manifest.
**Create** - creates the shipment but does not allocate a tracking number, print the label(s) or return the label(s) in the createShipment Response. The label(s) must be printed before the shipment is ready to manifest.
**Allocate** - creates the tracking number and label(s) but does not print the label(s) or return label(s) in the createShipment response. The label(s) must be printed before the shipment is ready to manifest.
Defaults to Process if not populated.

ReasonForExport.description:
Used to provide the reason an international shipment is being sent e.g. Sale, Gift, Return etc.
Mandatory for Royal Mail international shipments and Yodel international shipments.
If there are no accepted values for the carrier stated below, any value can be provided in the field.
For shipments where the carrier is UPU affiliated and the service is a postal service, then only the following values are accepted:
**Gift**
**Commercial Sample**
**Documents**
**Sale of Goods**
**Return of Goods**
**Mixed Content**
**Other**
For Yodel shipments, only the following values are accepted:
**Sales**
**Gift**
**Sample**
**Personal**

PreRegistrationNumber.description:
Some countries operate a Tax Pre-Registration scheme (e.g., VOEC in Norway, GST in Australia). If you are registered for a Tax Pre-Registration scheme for the destination country and are shipping under the scheme rules then provide the pre-registration number for the destination country.
A pre-registration number is only relevant if the shipment Incoterms are DDU (Delivery Duty Unpaid).
If not provided and the shipment incoterms are set to DDU, any pre-registration numbers set up for your account in the Customs Settings GUI will be used.
**NOTE**: VAT and EORI numbers should be provided in the Shipper VatNumber and Shipper EoriNumber fields, not in the preRegistrationNumber fields.

PreRegistrationType.description:
The type of pre-registration number provided in the PreRegistrationNumber element.
Required if a pre-registration number has been provided.
Ignored if there is no pre-registration number.
**NOTE:** VAT and EORI numbers should be provided in the Shipper VatNumber and Shipper EoriNumber fields, not in the preRegistrationNumber and PreRegistrationType fields

ShippingCharges.description:
Shipping Charges for International Shipments.
The postage amount paid by the customer. The amount can be 0.00 if the customer has been offered free delivery.
Used for the calculation of customs fees.
Any value should be in the currency specified in the ShipmentInformation/Currency field.

OtherCharges.description:
Insurance and Other Costs for International Shipments.
Used to declare any costs the customer has been charged in addition to the standard shipping cost, such as insurance.
This field can be left blank, or be 0.00 if no other charges have been levied.
Any value should be in the currency specified in the ShipmentInformation/Currency field.

QuotedLandedCost.description:
The total cost quoted to the customer for delivering the shipment. This includes shipping charges, other charges and any customs taxes and duties charges that were quoted.
Required for some international destinations when the shipment incoterms are DDP.
Any value should be in the currency specified in the ShipmentInformation/Currency field.

InvoiceNumber.description:
Invoice Number for International Shipments.
When sending an item to an overseas address and a Commercial or Proforma invoice is available, the Invoice Number and Date should be provided where possible. This supports customs processing in certain circumstances.
Required if Invoice Date is provided.
If provided, this will be displayed on commercial invoices generated for the shipment.

InvoiceDate.description:
If not provided, defaults to today's date.
Ignored if no Invoice Number provided.
Accepted Format: YYYY-MM-DD

ExportLicenceRequired.description:
Used to flag shipments requiring an export license.
An export license is neeed for a specific type of goods used predominantly for military purposes.
You can find out more about the type of items requiring an export licence on the UK Government website.
If an export licence is required, it should be affixed to the outside of the package.

Airn.description:
The AIRN (Addressee Identification Reference Number) is the generic name given to a national identification number for the overseas recipient of an item.
The AIRN, when available, should be provided for items being exported to a destination where the customs/tax authority requests one. E.g. Russia and Brazil.

Customs.description:
Customs Information
Required for some international shipments, depending on the customs requirements of the destination country.
A shipment is considered to be international if the shipper country and destination country are different.

ShipmentId.description:
Shipment Id
The shipment to apply the change to.

The Shipment Id may be an id or a tracking/barcode number.

ShipmentDate.description:
Shipment Date
The new date that the packages are being shipped.
The date must not be in the past and cannot be more than 28 days in the future.

Accepted Format: YYYY-MM-DD

EoriNumber.description:
Receiver's Economic Operators and Registration Identification (EORI) number, if applicable (i.e. if the receiver is a business). If a Receiver EORI number is used for the shipment, it must be provided here and not in the Customs element.
Receiver's EORI number starts with the ISO Alpha-2 Country Code followed by a maximum 15 alphanumeric characters. For Northern Ireland starts with XI

VatNumber.description: Receiver's Value-Added Tax (VAT) number, if applicable (i.e. if the receiver is a business). If a Receiver VAT number is used for the shipment, it must be provided here and not in the Customs element.

Destination.description: Used to provide details of the shipment destination, such as receiver address and contact details

CountryCode.description:
Country Code
2 Digit ISO Country Code, per ISO 3166 Standard.

Postcode.description:
Postcode / Zip
Required for United Kingdom addresses and some international addresses.
The Countries API can be used to check whether postcode/zip code is required for a country.
Up to 20 characters may be allowed, however it is carrier dependent and some carriers may allow less.
Royal Mail: 9 characters.

Length.description:
The length of the shipment package in the unit of measure specified in the DimensionsUnitOfMeasure field (DimensionsUnitOfMeasure defaults to CM if not provided).
The maximum length accepted is dependent on the service and package type.

Width.description:
The width of the shipment package in the unit of measure specified in the DimensionsUnitOfMeasure field (DimensionsUnitOfMeasure defaults to CM if not provided).
The maximum width accepted is dependent on the service and package type.

Height.description:
The height of the shipment package in the unit of measure specified in the DimensionsUnitOfMeasure field (DimensionsUnitOfMeasure defaults to CM if not provided).
The maximum height accepted is dependent on the service and package type.

Dimensions.description:
The package dimensions.
**The presence of the Dimensions element in the request is optional, but if it is provided, then all of the fields in the element (width, length and height) must be populated.** The maximum dimensions accepted are dependent on the service and the package type.

DimensionsUnitOfMeasure.description:
The unit of measure used for all dimension values (e.g. Length, Width, Height).
Valid values are: CM, MM
Defaults to CM if not populated.

DocumentFormat.description:
Document Format

**PDF** Base 64 encoded PDF
**PNG** Base 64 encoded PNG
**ZPL203DPI** Base 64 encoded text for Zebra printer at 203 DPI
**ZPL300DPI** Base 64 encoded text for Zebra printer at 300 DPI

Defaults To PDF

DocumentType.description:
Document Type
Defaults to CN23

**CN23** CN23
**PI** Proforma Invoice
**CI** Commercial Invoice

Message.example: The first line of the address is required.

ErrorCode.description:
Error Code
The error code for this error.

**E1000** - System error
**E1001** - Required field
**E1002** - Invalid field
**E1003** - Invalid action
**E1004** - Item not found

Message.description:
Message
General reason as to why there is an error. Further details may be contained in the list of errors.

Errors.description:
Errors
Details about why a request failed.

ErrorResponse.description: An error response from a request.

SkuCode.description: Stock Keeping Unit number of the item.

PackageOccurrence.description:
Used to assign this item to a specific package.
The Package Occurrence provided here must exist on one of the packages in the Package element.
Note: For dutiable multi-package shipments that are not using a consignment service, items must be assigned to a package so that accurate customs information is given.
Therefore, if the shipment contains more than one package, and it isn't using a consignment service, then Package Occurrence is required.

Quantity.description: The quantity of these items in the package.

Description.description:
Description of the item. This must describe the specific item being shipped rather than the general nature of the goods e.g. 'skirt' instead of 'ladies clothing'.

Required for dutiable shipments, unless the SKU Code of a stored product is provided. When the SKU Code of a stored product is provided, and this field is not provided, it will be populated from the stored product. If the SKU code of a stored product is provided, and this field is provided in the Create Shipment request, then the data provided in this field will be used instead of the data from the stored product.

Value.description:
The value of a single instance of the item, in the currency provided for the shipment in the CurrencyCode field.

Required for dutiable shipments, unless the SKU Code of a stored product is provided. When the SKU Code of a stored product is provided, and this field is not provided, it will be populated from the stored product. If the SKU code of a stored product is provided, and this field is provided in the Create Shipment request, then the data provided in this field will be used instead of the data from the stored product.

Weight.description:
The weight of a single instance of the item, in the unit of measure provided in the WeightUnitOfMeasure element (defaults to KG).
For non-dutiable shipments, a weight of 0 is accepted. For dutiable shipments, an item weight of 1 gram or greater must be provided.
The maximum weight accepted is 1000 KG.

Required for dutiable shipments, unless the SKU Code of a stored product is provided. When the SKU Code of a stored product is provided, and this field is not provided, it will be populated from the stored product. If the SKU code of a stored product is provided, and this field is provided in the Create Shipment request, then the data provided in this field will be used instead of the data from the stored product.

HSCode.description:
The Harmonized Commodity Description and Coding System Code.
Used by Customs to calculate potential duties and taxes.
May be required for dutiable shipments, depending on the carrier and destination country.
The number of characters required for the HS Code may vary depending on the service and destination country.
Dots and spaces in the HS Code are accepted.
For more information on HS Codes and to find the correct HS Codes for your items, see https://www.gov.uk/trade-tariff

CountryOfOrigin.description:
Country the item was produced/manufactured in.
2 Digit ISO Country Code, per ISO 3166 Standard.
May be required on dutiable shipments, depending on the carrier and destination country.

Item.description:
Used to provide details of the items sent in the shipment package(s).
Item information is optional for domestic and non-dutiable shipments, but required for dutiable shipments.
If item information is provided, this element must be repeated for each unique item in the shipment.

ShippingLocationId.description:
Shipping Location the shipment is being shipped from. This can be populated with either the Shipping Location ID assigned by PRO SHIPPING or the Shipping Location Alias set when the Shipping Location was created. Both can be viewed in the Shipping Location GUI.
Mandatory if there is more than one Shipping Location available for the Shipping Account

ShippingAccountId.description: Shipping Account the shipment is being created for. This can be populated with either the Shipping Account ID assigned by PRO SHIPPING Shipping Account ID or the Shipping Account Alias set when the Shipping Account was created.Both can be viewed in the Shipping Account GUI.

ServiceCode.description: The code of the shipping service used to deliver the shipment.

ServiceLevel.description:
The Royal Mail service level of the service specified in the ServiceCode field.
Valid values are 01-99.
Defaults to lowest service level available for the specified service if not provided.

PreAllocateTrackingNumberRequest.description: Royal Mail Get Pre Allocated Tracking Number Request

PreAllocateTrackingNumberResponse.description: Royal Mail Get Pre Allocated Tracking Number Response

EoriNumber.description:
EORI Number
Shipper/Receiver's EORI number starts with the ISO Alpha-2 Country Code followed by a maximum 15 alphanumeric characters. For Northern Ireland starts with XI
Overrides the shipper's EORI number on the shipment if provided.
If both an EORI and VAT number exist, then only the EORI Number is printed on the CN23.

VatNumber.description:
VAT Number
Overrides the shipper's VAT number on the shipment if provided.

ReasonForExport.description:
Reason for Export
Overrides the shipment's Reason for Export if provided.
If the carrier is UPU affiliated, then the allowed Reason for Exports are:
**Gift**
**Commercial Sample**
**Documents**
**Sale of Goods**
**Return of Goods**
**Mixed Content**
**Other**

Name.description:
Shipper's Name
Override the shipment's shipper's company/contact name if provided.

Position.description:
Position
The shipper's job title in the sender's company.
*Note: The field can only be used with the proforma and commercial invoice. It will be ignored for CN23s.*

SignatureImage.description:
Signature Image
Base 64 encoded PNG or JPEG. Maximum image size supported is 240 x 34 pixels.
*Note: The field can only be used with the proforma and commercial invoice. It will be ignored for CN23s.*

CompanyStampImage.description:
Company Stamp Image
Base 64 encoded PNG or JPEG. Maximum image size supported is 600 x 66 pixels.
*Note: The field can only be used with the proforma and commercial invoice. It will be ignored for CN23s.*

ReturnToSender.description:
Return To Sender information such as address and contact details
If not provided, the Shipping Location's address is used.

ShippingLocationId.description:
Shipping Location Identifier
PRO SHIPPING Shipping Location Id(assigned by PRO SHIPPING) or Alias(assigned by you).

Link an existing location to this account.
Either a Shipping Location Id must be provided, or the details of a new shipping location provided.

PostingLocationCode.description:
Posting Location Code
The number assigned to this Location by Royal Mail.

ObaAccessCode.description:
OBA Access Code
A password for the account to access the OBA services.
A Royal Mail shipping account cannot be active unless the OBA Access code has been provided.

ReceivingHubCode.description:
Receiving Hub Code
Receiving Hub/Regional Distribution Center used for this Shipping Location.
Must be an existing receiving hub code.
Please refer to Royal Mail ReceivingHubs for a list of possible receiving hubs.
If the receiving hub is not provided, we will match it to the one that corresponds to the postcode of the location's address.

RoyalMailAddShippingAccountLocation.description: Royal Mail Add Shipping Account Location

AccountNumber.description:
Carrier Account Number
The account number given by the carrier.

AccountName.description:
Account Name
The name on this Account.
Defaults to your Customer name if not provided.

AccountRegisteredEmail.description:
Account Registered Email
This is the email that was used to register your Shipping Account with the carrier when the Shipping Account was created.

AccountAlias.description:
Account Alias
Your identifier for this account. Must be unique.

ContactName.description:
Contact Name
Used in a create shipment request as the shipper's contact name if the shipper address is not provided.

ContactNumber.description:
Contact Number
Used in a create shipment request as the shipper's contact number if the shipper address is not provided, and the contact number is not set on the associated shipping location.

ShippingLocations.description:
Shipping Locations
At least one location is required when adding a shipping account.
If providing a new location when adding the account, only one location can be added.

RoyalMailAddShippingAccountRequest.description: Royal Mail Add Shipping Account Request

Primary2DBarcodeImage.description:
Primary 2D Barcode Image
Base64 Encoded PNG Image of the 2D data matrix barcode.

Primary2DBarcodeData.description:
Primary 2D Barcode Data - Base 64 Encoded
Data required to create your own 2D data matrix barcode. Please decode before use.

FormattedUniqueId.description:
Formatted Unique Id
Label for 2D data matrix barcode.

Primary1DBarcodeImage.description:
Primary 1D Barcode Image
Only populated where the service requires the barcode on the label.
Base64 Encoded PNG Image of the barcode.

Primary1DBarcodeData.description:
Primary 1D Barcode Data
Only populated where the service requires the barcode on the label.
Data required to create your own barcode.

HighVolumeBarcodeImage.description:
High Volume Barcode Image
Only populated where the service (Tracked High Volume) requires the barcode on the label.
Base64 Encoded PNG Image of the barcode.

HighVolumeBarcodeData.description:
High Volume Barcode Data
Only populated where the service (Tracked High Volume) requires the barcode on the label.
Data required to create your own barcode.

RoyalMailDataStreamDetails.description:
DATASTREAM Details
The information needed to create your own label.
Only present if DATASTREAM label format was specified.

RoyalMailEnhancementCode.description:
Enhancement code of the service enhancement. Valid values are:
**CL1** - Consequential Loss £1000
**CL2** - Consequential Loss £2500
**CL3** - Consequential Loss £5000
**CL4** - Consequential Loss £7500
**CL5** - Consequential Loss £10000 (Only 1 type of Consequential Loss is allowed)
**Signed** - a signature is required on delivery of the shipment. Can be used with 24, 48, 1st Class and 2nd Class services.
**SMS** - delivery updates will be sent via SMS. Can be used with Special Delivery Guaranteed, Tracked and Tracked High Volume services.
**Email** - delivery updates will be sent via email. Can be used with Special Delivery Guaranteed, Tracked and Tracked High Volume, International Tracked and International Tracked and Signed services.
**Safeplace** - the shipment will be left in a specified safeplace location. The location must be provided in the SafeplaceLocation field. Can be used with Tracked, Tracked High Volume and 24/48 services.
**LocalCollect** - the shipment will be delivered to a Post Office for collection by the receiver. Can be used with Special Delivery Guaranteed, Tracked and Tracked High Volume services.
**CustomsEmail** - Receiver email address will be used in eCustoms data. Can be used with International services.
**CustomsPhone** - Receiver email address will be used in eCustoms data.Can be used with International services.

Part1.description: First Part of the Gazetteer code.

Part2.description: Second Part of the Gazetteer code.

Part3.description: Third Part of the Gazetteer code.

Part4.description: Fourth Part of the Gazetteer code.

ShippingLocationId.description: This can be populated with either the Shipping Location ID assigned by PRO SHIPPING or the Shipping Location Alias set when the Shipping Location was created. Optional if the shipping account only has one Shipping Location assigned. If the Shipping Account has multiple Shipping Locations, then this field must be populated.

ShippingAccountId.description: Shipping Account the number range is being requested for. This can be populated with either the Shipping Account ID assigned by PRO SHIPPING or the Shipping Account Alias set when the Shipping Account was created.

ServiceLevel.description:
The Royal Mail service level of the service specified in the ServiceCode field.
Valid values are 01-99.

ChannelId.description: The Channel ID agreed with Royal Mail for the offline barcodes. If no value is sent in the request then the Channel ID assigned in PRO SHIPPING will be used.

RoyalMailGetOfflineBarcodingRequest.description: Royal Mail Get Offline Barcoding Request

ChannelId.description: The Channel ID sent in the request, If none was sent in the request, then it will be populated with the Channel Id assigned in the system to the customer account.

RoyalMailLabelFormat.description:
Sets the label format that will be returned in the createShipment Response.
Valid values are:
**PDF** - returns a Base64-encoded PDF
**PNG** - returns a Base64-enconded PNG
**ZPL203DPI** - returns Base 64 encoded text for Zebra printer at 203 DPI
**ZPL300DPI** - returns Base 64 encoded text for Zebra printer at 300 DPI
**DATASTREAM** - returns the label elements such as tracking URL, barcode number, 2D barcode image etc. for the label to be created in your own system, rather than returning a label image
Defaults to PDF if not populated.

ConsignmentShipmentId.description:
Consignment Shipment Id
Only populated if the service is a consignment service.

ConsignmentTrackingNumber.description:
Consignment Tracking Number
Only populated if the service is a consignment service

ConsignmentCarrierTrackingUrl.description:
Consignment Carrier Tracking URL
Only populated if the service is a consignment service and is available

Documents.description:
Customs Documents
Populated if requested Action was 'Process' and shipment is dutiable

Label.description:
Label
Base 64 Encoded String of the given label format.

ServiceCode.description: The code of the shipping service used to deliver the shipment.

DescriptionOfGoods.description: A general description of the type of goods being sent.

ShipmentDate.description:
The date the shipment packages will be shipped.
Shipment Date cannot be in the past and cannot be more than 28 days in the future.
Defaults to the current date if not populated.
Accepted Format: YYYY-MM-DD

DeclaredValue.description:
The declared value of the total shipment in the currency specified.
If provided, the value must be equal to or greater than the sum of all item values.
If not provided it defaults to the sum of all item values.
Ignored for Non-Consignment Services where multiple packages are declared - use the Declared Value at package level instead.

DeclaredWeight.description:
The declared weight of the total shipment in the unit of measure specified by WeightUnitOfMeasure (defaults to KG).
The minimum weight allowed is 1 gram.
The maximum weight is dependent on the carrier / service / destination.
The weight must be equal to or greater than the sum of all package weights and/or item weights.
Required for Consignment Services.
Ignored for Non-Consignment Services - use the Declared Weight at package level instead.

CurrencyCode.description:
The currency code used for any monetary value related to the shipment.
3 letter ISO Currency Code.
*Required if any monetary values other than zero are provided.*

RoyalMailLabelFormatShipmentInformation.description: Used to provide shipment-level information such as service code, content type, general goods description, total shipment weight and value etc.

ShippingLocationId.description:
Shipping Location Identifier
PRO SHIPPING Shipping Location Id(assigned by PRO SHIPPING) or Alias(assigned by you).

PostingLocationCode.description:
Posting Location Code
The number assigned to this Location by Royal Mail.

ObaAccessCode.description:
OBA Access Code
A password for the account to access the OBA services.
A Royal Mail shipping account cannot be active unless the OBA Access code has been provided.

ReceivingHubCode.description:
Receiving Hub Code
Receiving Hub/Regional Distribution Center used for this Shipping Location.
Must be an existing receiving hub code.
Please refer to Royal Mail ReceivingHubs for a list of possible receiving hubs.
If the receiving hub is not provided, we will match it to the one that corresponds to the postcode of the location's address.

RoyalMailLinkShippingAccountLocation.description: Royal Mail Link Shipping Account Location

PackageOccurrence.description:
This is used to assign barcodes to the packages.
If provided, each package occurrence must be unique.

TrackingNumber.description: The tracking number to use for the shipment. This will be mandatory for all services that require a 1D barcode.

UniqueId.description: The unique Id assigned by Royal Mail, either in full (21 characters) or the customer sequence (8 characters).

RoyalMailOfflineBarcode.description:
The Offline Barcode element is used to create a shipment record for a shipment that had a tracking number allocated outside of PRO SHIPPING.
Offline Barcoding is only available if it has been activated on your customer account in the GUI.
If the Offline Barcode information is provided, then Process is the only valid action accepted in the Action field.
"OfflineBarcode" has been deprecated. Please use "OfflineBarcodes" instead.

RoyalMailOfflineBarcodingEnhancementCode.description:
The only valid values are Signed or null.
Signed - a signature is required on delivery of the shipment. Can be used with 24, 48, 1st Class and 2nd Class services.

PackageOccurrence.description:
Used to match a returned Package ID to this package.
Can also be used to assign items to this package.
If provided, each package occurrence must be unique.
Note: For dutiable multi-package shipments that are not using a consignment service, items must be assigned to a package so that accurate customs information is given.
Therefore, if the shipment contains more than one package, and it isn't using a consignment service, then Package Occurrence is required.

DeclaredWeight.description:
The total weight of this package in the unit of measure specified by WeightUnitOfMeasure (defaults to KG).
The minimum weight allowed is 1 gram.
The maximum weight is dependent on the carrier / service / destination.
Mandatory for shipments using non-consignment services.

DeclaredValue.description:
The declared value of the total package in the currency specified.
If provided, the value must be equal or greater than the sum of all item values assigned to this package.
If not provided it defaults to the sum of all item values.
Used for shipment using non-consignment services, but not mandatory.

RoyalMailPackageTypeCode.description:
The package type used for the shipment.
Defaults to largest package type for the requested service, if not provided.

RoyalMailPreAllocatedTrackingNumberEnhan.description:
Enhancement code of the service enhancement. Valid value is:
**Signed** - a signature is required on delivery of the shipment. Can be used with 24, 48, 1st Class and 2nd Class services.

SafeplaceLocation.description:
Safeplace location the shipment will be delivered to.
Required if the Safeplace enhancement is used.

ServiceLevel.description:
The Royal Mail service level of the service specified in the ServiceCode field.
Valid values are 01-99.
Defaults to lowest service level available for the specified service if not provided.

EbayVtn.description: The eBay Virtual Tracking Number. This should be provided for all shipments that relate to orders created on eBay, so that the shipment tracking data can be made available on eBay.

ServiceEnhancements.description:
Service Enhancements
Any enhancements that you would like to add to the requested service.
A maximum of 4 service enhancements can be used per shipment.

OfflineBarcodes.description:
The Offline Barcodes element is to create shipment records for shipments that had a tracking number allocated outside of PRO SHIPPING.
Offline Barcoding is only available if it has been activated on your customer account in the GUI.
If Offline Barcodes information is provided, then Process is the only valid action accepted in the Action field.

PreAllocatedTrackingNumber.description: The pre-allocated tracking number to use for the shipment. Shipping Account, Shipping Location, Service Code, Destination Country and Postcode where required for the Country of Destination must match the one sent when the pre-allocation barcode was requested.

RoyalMailShipmentRequestCarrierSpecifics.description: Royal Mail-specific features that can be used when creating a Royal Mail shipment.

Packages.description:
Shipment Packages
The packages that are being sent in this shipment.
There must be at least 1 package.
A maximum of 99 packages is allowed.

Items.description:
Shipment Items
The items contained in the shipment, i.e. the goods/products being shipped
Item information is required for dutiable shipments for customs purposes.
Non-Dutiable shipments and 'Documents Only' (DOX) shipments do not require item information.
If Item Verification check on shipment creation is enabled, the maximum number of distinct items that will be verified in one shipment is 15.

UniqueId.description:
Unique Id
The Unique Id assigned by Royal Mail

PackageOccurrence.description:
Package Occurrence
The package occurrence you gave to the package, or if not provided, the default package occurrence.

TrackingNumber.description:
Tracking Number
The tracking number for this package occurrence.

CarrierTrackingUrl.description:
Tracking URL
The carrier's tracking URL.
Only present if available.

ShipmentId.description:
Shipment Id
Only populated if the service is a non-consignment service.

ShippingAccountId.description:
Shipping Account Id
The system identifier for this account.
Use one of the Id or Alias in the Create Shipment Request to identify the account to use.

CarrierCode.description:
Carrier Code
The carrier that this shipping account is for.

AccountNumber.description:
Carrier Account Number
The account number given by the carrier.

AccountName.description:
Shipping Account Name
The name of the Shipping Account.

AccountRegisteredEmail.description:
Account Registered Email
This is the email that was used to register your Shipping Account with the carrier when the Shipping Account was created.

AccountAlias.description:
Shipping Account Alias
Your identifier for this account. Must be unique.

AccountStatus.description:
Account Status
The status of the shipping account.

ContactName.description:
Contact Name
Used in a create shipment request as the shipper's contact name if the shipper address is not provided.

ContactNumber.description:
Contact Number
Used in a create shipment request as the shipper's contact number if the shipper address is not provided, and the contact number is not set on the associated shipping location.

LastUpdatedBy.description:
Last Updated By
The user that last updated the shipping account.

LastUpdatedDateUtc.description:
Last Updated Date UTC
The system date and time when the shipping account was last updated.

RoyalMailShippingAccount.description:
Shipping Account
An account that sends shipments. A shipping account is for a specified carrier.
You can have multiple shipping accounts.
A Shipping Account must have at least one Shipping Location.

ShippingAccounts.description:
Shipping Accounts
The shipping accounts for the requested page only.

TotalCount.description:
Total Count
The total number of accounts available

RoyalMailShippingAccountShippingAccounts.description: The paged response containing the entities for the requested page only, and the total number available.

PostingLocationCode.description:
Posting Location Code
The number assigned to this Location by Royal Mail.

ObaAccessCode.description:
OBA Access Code
A password for the account to access the OBA services.
A Royal Mail shipping account cannot be active unless the OBA Access code has been provided.

ReceivingHubCode.description:
Receiving Hub Code
Receiving Hub/Regional Distribution Center used for this Shipping Location.
Must be an existing receiving hub code.
Please refer to Royal Mail ReceivingHubs for a list of possible receiving hubs.

RoyalMailUpdateShippingAccountLocation.description: Royal Mail Update Shipping Account Location

AccountRegisteredEmail.description:
Account Registered Email
This is the email that was used to register your Shipping Account with the carrier when the Shipping Account was created.

AccountName.description:
Account Name
The name on this Account.

AccountAlias.description:
Account Alias
Your identifier for this account. Must be unique.

ContactName.description:
Contact Name
Used in a create shipment request as the shipper's contact name if the shipper address is not provided.

ContactNumber.description:
Contact Number
Used in a create shipment request as the shipper's contact number if the shipper address is not provided, and the contact number is not set on the associated shipping location.

RoyalMailUpdateShippingAccountRequest.description: Royal Mail Update Shipping Account Request

ReceivingHubDescription.description:
Receiving Hub Description
The name and postcodes covered by the Receiving Hub as per the Gazetteer file.

PostingLocationCode.description:
Posting Location Code
The number assigned to this Location by Royal Mail.

ObaAccessCode.description:
OBA Access Code
A password for the account to access the OBA services.
A Royal Mail shipping account cannot be active unless the OBA Access code has been provided.

ReceivingHubCode.description:
Receiving Hub Code
Receiving Hub/Regional Distribution Center used for this Shipping Location.
Must be an existing receiving hub code.
Please refer to Royal Mail ReceivingHubs for a list of possible receiving hubs.

RoyalMailViewShippingAccountLocation.description: Royal Mail View Shipping Account Location

ShippingLocationId.description:
Shipping Location Id
The system identifier for this shipping location.

LocationAlias.description:
Shipping Location Alias
Your identifier for this shipping location. Must be unique.

RoyalMailViewShippingAccountLocationShip.description:
Shipping Location
A location where the shipping account sends shipments from.
Every Shipping Account must have at least one Shipping Location.
A shipping account can have lots of shipping locations.
Each shipment created must be from an existing shipping location.

ShippingLocations.description:
Shipping Locations
The shipping locations for the requested page only.

TotalCount.description:
Total Count
The total number of locations available

RoyalMailViewShippingAccountLocationShip.description: The paged response containing the entities for the requested page only, and the total number available.

ContactName.description:
Either Contact Name or Company Name must be provided.
Up to 50 characters may be allowed, however it is carrier dependent and some carriers may allow less.
Royal Mail: 40 characters

CompanyName.description:
Either Contact Name or Company Name must be provided.
Up to 50 characters may be allowed, however it is carrier dependent and some carriers may allow less.
Royal Mail: 40 characters

Line1.description:
First Line Address
Up to 50 characters may be allowed, however it is carrier dependent and some carriers may allow less.
Royal Mail: 40 characters

Line2.description:
Second Line Address, if applicable
Up to 50 characters may be allowed, however it is carrier dependent and some carriers may allow less.
Royal Mail: 40 characters

Line3.description:
Third Line Address, if applicable
Up to 50 characters may be allowed, however it is carrier dependent and some carriers may allow less.
Royal Mail: 40 characters

Town.description:
Town
Up to 50 characters may be allowed, however it is carrier dependent and some carriers may allow less.
Royal Mail: 40 characters

Postcode.description:
Postcode / Zip
Required for United Kingdom addresses and some international addresses.
The Countries API can be used to check whether postcode/zip code is required for a country.
Up to 20 characters may be allowed, however it is carrier dependent and some carriers may allow less.
Royal Mail: 10 characters

County.description:
County / State / Province
May be required depending on the country.
USA, Australia and Canada all require a valid state code or name.
The Countries API can be used to check whether county/state is required for a country.
Up to 50 characters may be allowed, however it is carrier dependent and some carriers may allow less.
Royal Mail: 40 characters

CountryCode.description:
Country Code
2 Digit ISO Country Code, per ISO 3166 Standard.

What3Words.description: The what3words identifier for this address.

Shipments.description:
Shipments
The shipments for the requested page only.

TotalCount.description:
Total Count
The total number of shipments matching the request.

ShipmentsPagedResponse.description: The paged response containing the entities for the requested page only, and the total number available.

ShippingAccountId.description: Shipping Account the shipment is being created for. This can be populated with either the Shipping Account ID assigned by PRO SHIPPING Shipping Account ID or the Shipping Account Alias set when the Shipping Account was created. Both can be viewed in the Shipping Account GUI.

ShippingLocationId.description:
Shipping Location the shipment is being shipped from. This can be populated with either the Shipping Location ID assigned by PRO SHIPPING or the Shipping Location Alias set when the Shipping Location was created.Both can be viewed in the Shipping Location GUI.
Mandatory if there is more than one Shipping Location available for the Shipping Account.

Reference1.description: The shipper's reference for this shipment - this is usually the shipper's order number that was provided to the consumer at the time the order was made.

Reference2.description: Optional second reference for this shipment.

DepartmentNumber.description:
Department Number
If provided for a Royal Mail shipment, Department Number must be exactly 10 characters and must be an existing Department Number that has been setup with Royal Mail.

EoriNumber.description:
Shipper's Economic Operators and Registration Identification (EORI) number. If a Shipper EORI number is used for the shipment, it must be provided here and not in the Customs element.
Shipper's EORI number starts with the ISO Alpha-2 Country Code followed by a maximum 15 alphanumeric characters. For Northern Ireland starts with XI

VatNumber.description: Shipper's Value Added Tax (VAT) Number. If a Shipper VAT number is used for the shipment, it must be provided here and not in the Customs element.

Shipper.description: Used to provide shipper details such as address, contact details, VAT and EORI number etc.

ContactName.description:
Either Contact Name or Company Name must be provided.
Up to 50 characters may be allowed, however it is carrier dependent and some carriers may allow less.
Royal Mail: 40 characters

CompanyName.description:
Either Contact Name or Company Name must be provided.
Up to 50 characters may be allowed, however it is carrier dependent and some carriers may allow less.
Royal Mail: 40 characters

Line1.description:
First Line Address
Up to 50 characters may be allowed, however it is carrier dependent and some carriers may allow less.
Royal Mail: 40 characters

Line2.description:
Second Line Address, if applicable
Up to 50 characters may be allowed, however it is carrier dependent and some carriers may allow less.
Royal Mail: 40 characters

Line3.description:
Third Line Address, if applicable
Up to 50 characters may be allowed, however it is carrier dependent and some carriers may allow less.
Royal Mail: 40 characters

Town.description:
Town
Up to 50 characters may be allowed, however it is carrier dependent and some carriers may allow less.
Royal Mail: 40 characters

Postcode.description:
Postcode / Zip
Required for United Kingdom addresses and some international addresses.
The Countries API can be used to check whether postcode/zip code is required for a country.
Up to 20 characters may be allowed, however it is carrier dependent and some carriers may allow less.
Royal Mail: 10 characters

County.description:
County / State / Province
May be required depending on the country.
USA, Australia and Canada all require a valid state code or name.
The Countries API can be used to check whether county/state is required for a country.
Up to 50 characters may be allowed, however it is carrier dependent and some carriers may allow less.
Royal Mail: 40 characters

CountryCode.description:
Country Code
2 Digit ISO Country Code, per ISO 3166 Standard.

What3Words.description: The what3words identifier for this address.

ShipperAddress.description:
Shipper Address
If not provided, the Shipping Location's address is used.

ShippingAccountId.description:
Shipping Account Id
The system identifier for this account.
Use one of the Id or Alias in the Create Shipment Request to identify the account to use.

CarrierCode.description:
Carrier Code
The carrier that this shipping account is for.

Carrier Account Number
The account number given by the carrier.

The name of the Shipping Account.

AccountAlias.description:
Shipping Account Alias
Your identifier for this account. Must be unique.

AccountStatus.description:
Account Status
The status of the shipping account.

ContactName.description:
Contact Name
Used in a create shipment request as the shipper's contact name if the shipper address is not provided.

ContactNumber.description:
Contact Number
Used in a create shipment request as the shipper's contact number if the shipper address is not provided, and the contact number is not set on the associated shipping location.

LastUpdatedBy.description:
Last Updated By
The user that last updated the shipping account.

LastUpdatedDateUtc.description:
Last Updated Date UTC
The system date and time when the shipping account was last updated.

ShippingAccount.description:
Shipping Account
An account that sends shipments. A shipping account is for a specified carrier.
You can have multiple shipping accounts.
A Shipping Account must have at least one Shipping Location.

ShippingAccounts.description:
Shipping Accounts
The shipping accounts for the requested page only.

TotalCount.description:
Total Count
The total number of accounts available

First Line Address
Up to 50 characters may be allowed, however it is carrier dependent and some carriers may allow less.
Royal Mail: 40 characters

The Countries API can be used to check whether postcode/zip code is required for a country.

CountryCode.description:
Country Code
2 Digit ISO Country Code, per ISO 3166 Standard.

What3Words.description: The what3words identifier for this address.

ContactPhone.description:
Contact Phone Number
If provided, and the shipper address is not provided for a create shipment request, this will be used as the shipper's contact phone number for this location, instead of the shipping account's contact phone number.

ShippingLocationId.description:
Shipping Location Identifier
PRO SHIPPING Shipping Location Id(assigned by PRO SHIPPING) or Alias(assigned by you).

TermsOfTrade.description:
International Commercial Terms (Incoterms) / Terms of Trade.
Valid values are:
**DDU** — Delivered Duty Unpaid. The receiver is responsible for paying customs duties and taxes.
**DDP** — Delivered Duty Paid. The seller is responsible for paying customs duties and taxes.
**DAP** — Delivered At Place. The receiver is responsible for paying customs duties and taxes.
**DAT** — Delivered At Terminal. The receiver is responsible for paying customs duties and taxes.
Defaults to DDU if not provided for dutiable shipments. Does not need to be provided for non-dutiable shipments.

Reason.description:
Reason
The reason for this status update.

If the status you are updating to is 'Hold' the reason is required and must be one of the following values:
**Awaiting Dispatch**
**Awaiting Payment**
**Awaiting Stock**
**Awaiting Customer Response**
**Held for Shipping Day**
**Weight Consolidation**
**Warehouse Processing**

If the status you are updating to is 'Cancel', the reason is required and must be one of the following values:
**Order Cancelled**
**Packed in Error**
**Repacked**

ShipmentIds.description:
Shipment Ids
The shipments to apply the change to.
There must be at least 1 shipment and a maximum of 99.

The Shipment Id may be an id or a tracking/barcode number.

UpdateStatusType.description:
Update Status Type

**Hold** - Put the shipments on hold for up to 28 days. Shipments on hold for longer than 28 days will be cancelled. A shipment on hold will not be included in an closeouts/manifests, but instead will remain in its current state. You can only put shipments on hold that are in the 'LabelPrinted' status as only shipments with this status are included in manifests.
**Cancel** - Use to cancel/void one or more current shipments. This can only be used before a shipment has been confirmed by being manifested.
**Release** - Use to release shipments from hold and shipments cancelled for less than 24 hours. Once released, the shipment will be included in the next manifest.
**Picked** - Set the shipment to picked. This means this shipment will only be manifested if you choose to manifest 'Picked' shipments.

WeightUnitOfMeasure.description:
The unit of measure used for all weight values in the shipment (e.g. DeclaredWeight, ItemWeight).
Valid values are KG, Grams.
Defaults to KG if not populated.

oauth2.description:
JSON Web Token (JWT) authorization header using the Bearer scheme.

Example: "bearer { token }"

tags.name: Shipping Accounts
tags.description:
This section provides information relating to managing shipping accounts.

A shipping account is where you assign your carrier credentials and link them to the relevant shipping location/s.

tags.name: Shipments
tags.description: This section provides information relating to creating Royal Mail shipments, printing shipping labels, the customs documentation and creating QR code for paperless returns.
